intro: Aconogonon brachytrichum, commonly known as the narrow-haired aconogonon, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and hairy stems. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Aconogonon brachytrichum is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
